body: God I wish I were her

The problem with simply diagnosing it as manipulation is no one really knows her inner mind processes, yes she's being held captive because Kota would die. But the fact that she's been complimented as a woman (must be quite a personal thing for her) made her heart flutter perhaps. The Stockholm syndrome is also a reasonable take, but she still has free will technically, not exactly captive, even if they're technically being held by the two. I think its more on manipulation but not completely, the aliens are keeping her for their greater gain as she has no choice but slowly you see this glimmer of budding "romance" forming between the two. Can't say its genuine fondness/liking, I think its just a small 'crush' type of thing. Because come on, wouldn't it be nice to hear someone compliment on your insecurities and say that it shouldn't matter because you're still pretty and all?
Ok, now i hope she ends up with demon dude
@ImTired It's manipulation. Stockholm is more being around them and starting to sympathize on their own with no manipulation.
It is Stockholm syndrome man I believe?
Isn't this some form of stockholm syndrome what he's doing to her, be mean at the beginning then be nice to control her; or just another form of manipulation
